body:
Comment 8 by **shakeel.mahate**: 
The new godoc template has an overview of the package, followed by constants, variables,
top level functions (or constructors), and then types. I was expecting to see the top
level function net.Dial  or net.Listen grouped together under the top level functions of
the net package. This might be my poor understanding of go code. 

I read some code that had net.Listen("unix", filename) and I wanted to learn more about
it, when I visited http://weekly.golang.org/pkg/net/ and tried to look for it in the
list of top level functions, I could not find it. Maybe permanent newbies like me might
get stumbled. I could not figure out that net.Listen was a constructor for Listener, now
I know better.
